member.summary: Extension methods for System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.

member.summary: Evaluate whether or not the first row, if any, is selected in the data grid view.

member.summary: Evaluate whether or not the last row, if any, is selected in the data grid view.

member.name: M:NExtra.WinForms.Extensions.DataGridViewExtensions.SelectAndShowRow(System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView,System.Int32)
member.summary: Select and show a row in a DataGridView.

member.name: M:NExtra.WinForms.Extensions.DataGridViewExtensions.SelectRow(System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView,System.Int32)
member.summary: Select a row in a DataGridView.

member.name: M:NExtra.WinForms.Extensions.DataGridViewExtensions.ShowRow(System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView,System.Int32)
member.summary: Shows a row and selects another one in a DataGridView. The function will handle invalid indices and also set the CurrentCell property of the DataGridView.

member.name: M:NExtra.WinForms.Extensions.DataGridViewExtensions.PaintImageCell(System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView,System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellPaintingEventArgs,System.Windows.Forms.ImageList,System.String)
member.summary:
Repaint an image cell with an image in an image list. Just execute this method in the CellPainting event of the DataGridView.
This method ignores invalid parameters. Providing it with empty or non-existing key indices will simply cause the event to abort.
member.param: The image list that contains the images
